isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - WT TRANSMISSION DIAGNOSTIC CODES - EXITING THE DIAGNOSTIC DISPLAY MODE

svcproc.title: EXITING THE DIAGNOSTIC DISPLAY MODE
svcproc.para: The diagnostic display mode can be exited by any of the following procedures:

step1.para: On a pushbutton shift selector, press the (Up) and (Down) arrow buttons at the same time or press any range button ( D, N, or R). The D, N, and R is commanded if not inhibited by an active code.
On a shift lever selector momentarily pushing the display mode button or moving the shift lever to any position other than the position it was in to perform the diagnostics.

note.para: If the shift is still inhibited, the ECU will continue to command the current range.

step1.para: Do nothing and wait until time out of the preprogrammed time, approximately 10 minutes, has passed and the system automatically returns to the normal operating mode.
Turn off power to the ECU (turn vehicle ignition key off).
